Final Report Code

1. Load packages and cleaned datasets

library(tidyverse)
library(data.table)
library(viridisLite)
library(viridis)
# Load datasets
daily_activity_clean <- fread("C:/Users/LG 14z/Documents/R/nhubao.github.io/daily_activity_clean.csv")
hourly_activity_clean <- fread("C:/Users/LG 14z/Documents/R/nhubao.github.io/hourly_activity_clean.csv")

2. Summary statistics about daily activities

  1. How many steps did users take in a day?
summary(daily_activity_clean$TotalSteps)
##    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
##       0    3818    7441    7671   10734   36019

Users took an average of 7671 steps in a day.

summary(daily_activity_clean$Calories)
##    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
##      52    1834    2144    2313    2794    4900

Users burned an average of 2313 Calories a day.

summary(daily_activity_clean$TotalDistance)
##    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
##   0.000   2.645   5.265   5.513   7.720  28.030

Users travelled an average distance of 5.513 km a day.

summary(daily_activity_clean$VeryActiveMinutes)
##    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
##    0.00    0.00    4.00   21.26   32.00  210.00

Users spent an average of 21 total minutes in very active activity a day.

summary(daily_activity_clean$FairlyActiveMinutes)
##    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
##    0.00    0.00    7.00   13.62   19.00  143.00

Users spent an average of 14 total minutes in fairly active activity a day.

summary(daily_activity_clean$LightlyActiveMinutes)
##    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
##     0.0   128.0   199.0   193.6   264.2   518.0

Users spent an average of 194 total minutes (about 3 hours) in lightly active activity a day.

summary(daily_activity_clean$SedentaryMinutes)
##    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
##     0.0   729.0  1057.0   989.3  1226.0  1440.0

Users spent an average of 989 total minutes (about 16 hours) in sedentary activity a day.

3. Is there a relationship between average steps and days of the week?

# Plot average steps by days of week
steps_week_plot <- daily_activity_clean %>% group_by(wday) %>% summarise(MeanTotalSteps = mean(TotalSteps)) %>% 
 ggplot(aes(x = wday,
             y = MeanTotalSteps,
             fill = MeanTotalSteps)) +
  geom_col(width = 0.7)+
  labs(title = "Average Daily Steps by Days of Week",
       x = NULL,
       y = "Average Daily Steps") +
  guides(fill = "none") +
  geom_text(aes(label = round(MeanTotalSteps)),
            color = "white",
            vjust = 1.5) +
  scale_fill_distiller(palette = "RdPu", direction = 1)

Users took the most steps on Tuesdays and Saturdays and least on Sundays.

4. What are the activity levels of users?

# Plot activity level distribution
activity_level_plot <- daily_activity_clean %>% 
  group_by(ActivityLevel) %>% 
  count() %>% 
  mutate(Percent = n / nrow(daily_activity_clean)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = ActivityLevel, 
             y = Percent, 
             fill = ActivityLevel)) +
  geom_col(width = 0.75) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Activity Levels", 
       x = NULL, 
       y = "% of Records") +
  guides(fill = "none") +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(Percent * 100, 1), "%")), 
            color = "white",
            vjust = 1.5)

About half of records were tracked as normal activity, 22.3% as active and 26.7% as sedentary.

5. What is the percentage of users that meet 10,000 steps a day?

ten_thousand_steps_plot <- daily_activity_clean %>% 
  group_by(Meets10000Steps) %>% 
  count() %>% 
  mutate(Percent = n / nrow(daily_activity_clean)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = Meets10000Steps, 
             y = Percent, 
             fill = Meets10000Steps)) +
  geom_col(width = 0.75) +
  labs(title = "Percent of daily records that meet 10,000 steps goal", 
       x = NULL, 
       y = "% of Records") +
  guides(fill = "none") +
  geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(Percent * 100, 1), "%")), 
            color = "white",
            vjust = 1.5)

About 65% of days respondents met 10,000 steps goal.

6. Top 3 highest total steps per day

 # Top 3 highest Total Steps per day by Id
top3_daily_steps <- daily_activity_clean %>%
  arrange(desc(TotalSteps)) %>% 
  group_by(Id) %>%
  slice(1:3) %>%
  select(Id, ActivityDate, TotalSteps)

# Plot for highest total steps
 top3_steps_plot <- top3_daily_steps %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = Id, 
             y = TotalSteps, 
             fill = TotalSteps)) +
  geom_col(width = 0.55, position="dodge2") +
  labs(title = "Top 3 most steps taken by each user", 
       x = NULL, 
       y = "Daily Steps") +
   scale_fill_distiller(palette = "YlOrRd", direction = 1) +
   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90))

7. What’s the relationship between steps taken in a day and sedentary minutes?

sedentary_steps_plot <- ggplot(daily_activity_clean, aes(x=SedentaryMinutes, y = TotalSteps)) + geom_point() +
  labs(title = "Steps Taken in a day vs. Sedentary Minutes",
       x = "Sedentary Minutes",
       y = "Steps taken in a day",
       size = "") + geom_smooth()

8. Is there a relationship between TotalIntensity and calories?

Intensity_C_plot <- ggplot(hourly_activity_clean, aes(x=TotalIntensity, y = Calories)) + geom_point() +
  labs(title = "Total Intensity vs. Calories",
       x = "Total Intensity",
       y = "Calories",
       size = "") + geom_smooth()

9. Heatmap Hourly Intensity

hourly_intensity_plot <- hourly_activity_clean %>%
  group_by(hours= hour(ActivityHour), wday) %>%
ggplot(aes(hours, wday)) +
  geom_tile(aes(fill = TotalIntensity), colour = "white") +
  scale_fill_distiller(palette = "YlOrRd", direction = 1) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = 0:23) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    legend.position = "bottom",
    legend.key.width = unit(2, "cm"),
    panel.grid = element_blank()
  ) +
   scale_fill_viridis(option = "magma", 
                     direction = -1, 
                     name = "TotalIntensity") +
  labs(title = "Total Intensity by Hour of Day", x = "", y = "") +
  coord_equal()
## Scale for 'fill' is already present. Adding another scale for 'fill', which
## will replace the existing scale.

10. Is there a relationship between total steps and days of the month?

# heatmap of Total Steps for the complete month
month_steps_plot <-
daily_activity_clean %>%
ggplot(aes(wday, y=week)) +
  geom_tile(aes(fill = TotalSteps), color = "white", size = .5) +
  geom_text(aes(label = day)) + 
  scale_fill_viridis(option = "magma", 
                     direction = -1, 
                     name = "Total Steps") +
  labs(title = "Total Steps by Date", x = "April to May", y = "") + 
  scale_y_continuous(trans = "reverse" ) +
  scale_x_discrete(position = "top")
